Tourist Attractions In Spain

There are many places of interest all over the country of Spain. This makes a tour to this country a very good idea. A well planned visit to this great land is always rewarding and educative. You should consider taking tours as a group so as to share ideas and make the most of your tour. It will be more fun and you will cover more ground.Granada is a town that offers guided tours covering Generallife and Alhambra. You will also be guided to fortresses, palaces, and other parts of the town that are historic and popular. Having an idea of what to expect on the ground is highly recommended as it will be easier to learn this way. The places you tour will be according to your specifications.Ibiza is another popular Spanish location. There are clubs here that operate till the odd hours. To avoid queues it is highly advisable to pre book so as to save money and time.Madrid, Spain's capital is also a major attraction. You can have guided tours here too. There are museums, bullfighting, as well as flamenco shows. Madrid by night is all the more interesting.Malaga offers sightseeing tours. A lot of activities can be arranged in most of the surrounding areas like Costa del Sol and Marbella. Santiago de compostella gives guided trips to Galicia, Portugal and Finisterre.The visits include to monuments, museums, as well as other historic places. The tours are guided by professional guides that know the places inside out. You will understand better when you have someone to walk you through your visit and you will also explore more places. You will also get to appreciate Spain's history.The guided tours cover the places closest to you so plan wisely on the places that you prioritize so as to get the best out of your tour. For a foreigner in Spain, the flamenco dance shows are a must see. Their origin is the gypsies that populate Andalusia. The night tours can also be guided if you are interested in seeing Spain’s nightlife. This way you will learn about the Spanish fiesta and know many night time areas.Corrida is a place where you get to understand Spaniards. This owes to the region being poetic. Spain would be incomplete without corrida. There is a lot of history to learn in Corrida. Popular artists loved Corrida. It is popular for bull fights.Spain is a great place to experience a different way of life and experience culture as never before. It is a visit that will never fade.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Click Link and Get more information on location maison vacances avec piscineHere you can read my articles :-- http://www.24by7articles.com/362636/174/MORE-ABOUT-TOURISM-IN-SPAIN.html. And My bookmarks :- http://www.youdoze.com/user.php?login=alinmariyn&view=history

Festival Nightlife As Tourist Attractions In Spain

Spain is one of the countries in the world that have been in the tourism sector for a long time. The World Tourist Organization actually has their headquarters in Spain. This shows that Spain was one of the main contributors to the development of tourism. There are a lot of attractions in Spain that will surely leave one dazed.One of the tourist attractions is actually the festivals. These festivals actually revolve around folklore, local customs as well as legends and patron saints. The Seville Fair is one of the most outstanding. Others include Fiestas del Pillar, Tomatina, Fallas and the Running Bulls held in Pamplona.The Canary Islands as well as Cadiz are popular for the carnival. There are also festivals related to the film industry that are held in many parts of the country. Some of the festivals include Monegros Desert Festival, Bilbao Festival, Primavera Sound, Festimad, FIB, the Sonar, Seminci Malaga Spanish Festival as well as Sebastian International Film Festival just to name a few.Some of the places that have hosted some international events are also major attractors. They include the cities of Barcelona, Madrid, Valencia, San Sebastian, Salamanca and Seville. These are some of the most popular Spanish cities that are most famous and receive the most visitors every year.The Spanish night life is not only an attrition to tourists but also to the locals. It is a place that is renowned for its amazing nightlife that extends even in the wee hours of the morning. The bigger cities have more facilities to cater for the nightlife. For discotheques, Barcelona and Madrid are good places to start. Madrid has a number of city clubs that are so large covering up to seven floors. Barcelona’s most popular is Sutton and opium clubs. Most clubs and discotheques stay open into the odd hours.Spain’s nightlife is perfect for the young and young at heart. There are areas in Spain that encourage nightlife to a great extent, it is not always about having a party as some people take to the streets to engage in the open market activities.Spain is the best place to be especially when you are with friends with a need to celebrate an event or an occasion. Moving from one club to the next is always an interesting venture that gets a lot of people’s attention. It is also a chance to explore the country and appreciate the festivals, events as well as all the activities that take place after dark.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Click Website and Get more information on location maison vacances espagne

Jerez de la Frontera

Andalusia is a vast region with many exciting towns and cities for discovery. One of them is Jerez de la Frontera that offers a rich and colorful history and culture.Jerez is named after its famous production of wine known as Sherry. This town is one of only three that produce the famous local sherry besides Sanlucar and El Puerto. However, each town’s sherry production differs. El Puerto’s sherry is more the finos and amontillados type and Sanlucar’s sherry offers different flavors and ranges like the manzanilla.Main industryHence, Jerez is renowned for its sherry production in its vast and fertile countryside that is inhabited by sherry and brandy vineyards. This sherry and wine industry is Jerez’s main commercial lifeline since its early production during the Anlo-Andaluz generations.The wine and sherry industry is booming well to contribute positively to the region’s economy and international renown. It is no wonder that ‘Jerez-Pura Andalucia’ is a big hit as the town slogan to refer to the abundantly beautiful rich vineyards and large estate lands in the midst of grand palaces and traditional Spanish culture such as bull fighting and flamenco.Sights of InterestJerez is an exciting town with a lot of happenings. While the bodegas tour is a must for all visitors, there are other sights of attraction in and around Jerez. Bodegas are winery production houses for observing the production of wine and sherry. Every visitor can taste and purchase some for home.Jerez has an interesting equestrian school called the Real Escuela Andaluza. This special school breeds majestic horses and trains them for special performances. There are many majestic stables which are beautifully decorated with properly kept carriages which are used in the training.Some days offer special training sessions while other days showcase a unique equestrian ballet performance that is breath-taking and impressive with the trained and skilled horses and trainers coordinating so harmoniously together. The equestrian performance uses vibrant Spanish music with performers and dancers arrayed in 17th century costumes.For art lovers, the Museo de Relojes is a must on the itinerary. This is the best of Europe’s art collection which is varied and delightful through its 300-strong display which dates around 17th to19th centuries.Fiestas and festivalsFiestas are popularly celebrated in Jerez with the annual Horse fair in May and Fiestas de Otoño in September or October. These are among the numerous fiestas and festivals which keep Jerez lively and vibrant throughout the year. The Feria de Caballo is one of Jerez’s biggest festival as well as the most festive celebration with a lot of merry making.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Visit Here and Get more information on locations vacances costa brava espagneHere you can read my articles :-- http://www.basearticles.com/Art/1003313/53/Jerez-de-la-Frontera.html. Flamenco Culture in Spain

Flamenco is synonymous with Spain as with bullfights; every Spaniard embraces the flamenco as part of the rich Spanish culture in the form of an exquisite art. This tradition is unique to Spain with a lot of pain and suffering that the performer is subjected to in order to transform it into perfection.Unique traditionThe locals call Flamenco ‘Sevilliana’ as it was purportedly originated from Seville. This dance and song performance stands excellently as an exquisite Spanish art through its expression in song (cante), dance (baile) and guitar playing (guitarra).Spanish gypsies have claimed to be the originators of the Spanish flamenco with an active participation throughout the decades. This is how a Spanish tradition is normally survived; the Andalusian dances and songs are passed down from generation to generation including the Flamenco.Over time, Flamenco Schools were established in Jerez and Cadiz Triana until its popularity peaked between 1869 and 1910.Forms and fameThe Flamenco started off with mere vocals and accompanied rhythmical clapping of the hands called the ‘toque de palmas.’ Reputable musicians and composers added on guitar music accompaniment later. Today, there is some jazz, salsa and bosa nova flavor to the traditional Flamenco.The Flamenco tradition was quite perfected at its peak as a definitive art form which was highly sought in cafes cantantes or music cafes all over Andalucia.There is a more serious form of Flamenco which expresses deep feelings known as the ‘cante jondo’. There is more guitar accompaniment through a unique Flamenco guitar.Vocals or singing came into the Flamenco between 1910 and 1955; hence, the birth of the ‘opera flamenca’ came on. Fandangos as well as cantes music also arose as accompaniment to the vocal flamencos.Various flamenco artisans would frown at such modifications and additions which are not considered true flamenco; these are viewed as drastic and untraditional modifications to the art of flamenco.As skilled Flamenco performers emerged from 1955, the flamenco presentations moved away from cafes cantantes to great theatres and concert halls performances. Flamenco guitarists became more outstanding in their Flamenco performance as they performed as an individual artist performing on their own merit and not merely as an accompaniment.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Click Here and Get more information on location maison vacances espagne avec piscineHere you can read my articles :-- http://goarticles.com/article/Flamenco-Culture-in-Spain/6961189/. Exciting Cities of Spain

There are many beautiful and exciting cities in Spain for one to explore. The country has a very rich culture stemming from a colorful history that includes traditions like the bullfights and flamencos.Ancient influences are very rooted in Spain as can be seen in every town and city although different lifestyles are practiced by the locals.Any visitor to Spain would experience an enriching holiday while touring Spain.Exciting BarcelonaBarcelona is an exciting and vibrant Spanish city that is famous for many things; one of them is tourism. There are many interesting historical sites to discover in Barcelona for any tourist; there are the fascinating church spires, neo-Gothic undulating curves, flashy designs, cobbled narrow streets and outstanding plazas.One would enjoy Las Ramblas that is an ancient quarter located near Cataluña Plaza which showcases historical sites of past civilizations. There are famous church buildings and impressive Gothic cathedrals at Las Ramblas.Barcelona also boasts of top class learning institutions that include academics, art, music and archaeology.Exciting MadridMadrid is not a city to be missed when touring Spain as it is currently the capital city. It is famous for arts, festivals and a vibrant nightlife. There are numerous bars, pubs and cafés to satisfy the locals and merrymakers all day and night.Museums abound in Madrid with the host of historical information about Madrid and Spain. Art museums form another good choice to appreciate the talents of Spain where a lot of masterpieces are on display including Picasso’s.There are special museums in Madrid which showcase some of the traditions of the region such as the Bullfighting museum. There is also the Cultural Center that showcases opera and theatre performances.Interesting historical sites such as the Royal Palace would thrill visitors to view the different majestic residential rooms built during 18th - 20th centuries.Exciting GranadaOne of the best attractions in Granada is the majestic Alhambra Palace. This is the best Moorish architecture that is left behind from previous eras. The building has been well preserved to showcase its exquisite patios, well kept courtyards, fabulous architecture, inlaid walls and intricate ceilings. The Alhambra served as a royal residence in its past glory with its majestic presence on a hilltop.Exciting CordobaCordoba lies south with the impressive Mezquita mosque which is purported the most beautiful in Europe. This Moorish architecture is more commonly known as the Alcazar which sports intrinsic designs that no current skills can match.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Learn More and Get more information on location vacances espagne piscineHere you can read my articles :-- http://www.basearticles.com/Art/1005458/53/Exciting-Cities-of-Spain.html. Provincial Beauty around Aragon

It is not surprising that flocks of visitors come to Aragon every summer to enjoy its sunshine and fine cities. This is not just another community in Spain; its strategic location close to France entices many French visitors with the majestic Pyrenees beckoning them.Zaragoza is the capital of Aragon with provinces Teruel and Huesca.Natural beautyThe Aragon region is naturally blessed with huge mountain ranges that brought about many alluring glacier lakes and rivers. These support the well nourished forest reserves where an abundance of flora and fauna thrive healthily. There are plenty of walking trails to appreciate the beauty of Ebro Valley and the quaint traditional villages that are picturesque on photographs.There are great landscape contrasts in Aragon where one can view the majestic mountains of Moncayo with the vast lush plains of Ebro Valley. There is a medieval era ambience through the provinces of Aragon. The famous kingdom of Aragon thrives on the everlasting Spanish culture that is based on medieval times with lots of interesting history.Plentiful activitiesThere is no lack of beautiful spots for the adventurous spirit to discover with the myriad of majestic mountain ranges, lakes and forests. Tourists to Aragon enjoy the wide range of winter activities such as skiing and skating while summer calls for picnics, seaside pleasures and strolls. The region is also famous for its wide selection of delectable gastronomy offerings which have been passed down through generations together with their traditions, culture and folklore.Historical beautiesThere are so many historical spots a little out of Aragon. Jaca is a nearby province at the edge of Aragon which used to earn the favor of Aragonese royal residences. Today it thrives as a lively town with historical monuments stretching from the Roman Empire. Its 10th century cathedral is an impressive Romanesque medieval architecture that is close to another unique Romanesque museum.The town hall is a fine Aragonese Plateresque structure with the Benedictine convent nearby that houses Queen Doña Sancha’s sarcophagus. This is an impressive 1592 citadel which was recently restored. Other Romanesque structures found here is the San Miguel Bridge.Lleida province which is also close to Aragon has many Romanesque and Moorish architectural monuments such as cathedrals, mosques and stately homes. There are exquisite 16th century cathedrals with a costly Forment built retable and palaces that saw better days. The ancient Pueyo Monastery is a reminder of the religious obligations and dedications of piety while there are always distinctive Town Halls and Plazas in almost every town and city in Aragon.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Visit Weblink and Get more information on séjours pas cher espagneHere you can read my articles :-- http://www.mes-articles.net/vacances/destinations/jerez-de-la-frontera.html. And My bookmarks :- http://weblinkr.com/alinmariyn

Scenic Delights with Asturia

One of the provinces in the great and fabulous Autonomous Community of Spain is Asturia. Its position is between Cantabria and Galicia. Asturia has undergone many aggressive battles especially with the Moors before settling down as a Christian kingdom.Asturia has many mountain ranges especially linking to Cantabria. There are many astounding sights of nature around Asturia. Its capital is Oviedo which showcases numerous churches, cathedrals and other ancient monuments in post-Gothic architecture.Gijon is one of the active Cantabrian ports today with a long beach that is attracting many visitors every year.The natural beauty around Asturia is picturesque with a pre-historical coast with caves and estuary all along the coast. The beaches at Asturia sport amazing cliffs with the national highway flanking on the other side.Scenic RouteTourists to Asturia would enjoy the scenic drive along the coastal road. One should spot the Bronze Age monolith, the Peña Tus statute, which dons intriguing shapes with no firm interpretation up till today. The drive would take one along ancient ports and quaint fishing villages that are still active in the midst of a growing tourism industry.Those who love ancient monuments would like the ancient quarters of Asturia where one can check out the skilled ancient architecture of the Santa Maria church which is of Gothic style as well as several palaces and mansions of Renaissance style.It is easy to reach the quaint fishing villages and ports along the scenic coastal road that showcase the majestic Mediterranean Sea with large rocks and caves.The N-634 Highway leads the tourists to Ribadesella which is an ancient port with urban amenities.Worthy stopoversOne would be delighted to make a pitstop at the Villaviciosa estuary which is really a city of apple orchards facing the Mediterranean Sea. This place is famous for the production of cider through its renowned fermentation process. Middle age churches abound with many pre-Romanesque era art and paintings in this city.Gijon offers lots of greens with its vast valleys and meadows that are also filled with fruitful apple orchards. It is an active industrial center and port that functions as a vibrant summer resort with many historical monuments.Tourists also flock to Cabo de Peñas resort for its alluring beaches and active fishing ports and villages. The Cabo de Peñas lighthouse offers great views of Cantabria’s coast if one is challenged by the hill.There is no lack of panoramic landscapes, estuaries and enclaves which would thrill the visitor to Asturia.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Click Here and Get more information on location de vacances en espagneHere you can read my articles :-- http://www.articlesunit.com/284125/174/Festival-Nightlife-As-Tourist-Attractions-In-Spain.html. Interesting Offerings from Andalucia

One of Spain’s biggest Autonomous Communities is Andalucia which comprises the provinces of Seville, Huelva, Córdoba, Malaga, Jaén, Almeria, Cádiz and Granada.Each province of Andalucia holds its own fascinating culture and traditions with a host of ancient monuments from Moorish, Roman and Celtic eras. The towns and cities are set against beautiful natural landscapes of hills, mountains, sea and beaches.Each city in Andalucia has specific offerings to entice the tourists as these cities compete to be the best in Andalucia.Spanish insightsThe history of Andalucia is colorful and long through the many centuries it has been occupied by various influences. The Moors who were of Arabic and Berber descent occupied Andalucia for about 800 years with a lot of culture and traditions instilled and lived out even till today. Civilization was said to be refined in the Middle Ages especially at Granada, Cordoba and Seville. However, the Christian Reconquesta remained a strong influence in later years after recapturing the region.Granada has a lot of well preserved Moorish monuments that reflect the strong Muslim influence at that province with the building of the Alhambra. This is the biggest and most impressive palace in Europe. Seville showcases spectacular Gothic cathedrals with some of the largest in the world.Huelva conducts its fishing activities with vigor as an important regional port that is surrounded by quaint villages and towns with much of the natural beauty around.ActivitiesThere is plenty to do and see in Andalucia. Its many villages, towns and cities can stop one at their tracks with the myriad of activities available at each place. Strolls and trekking activities are plentiful on the beaches, forest reserves or at the mountain ranges. Skiing and skating are available on the Sierra Morena and Sierra Nevada.Tourists would be enthralled by Spain’s traditions and cultures like flamenco dancing and bullfights. However, there is no lack of festivals and fiestas which are vibrantly celebrated throughout the year.The Andalucian sacred pilgrimage procession is well attended from all over Spain as well as outside. Many tourists come as observers and participants. There are Lent in February and the Semana Santa in March with Good Friday and Easter April that comes with carnivals and bull runs.Many of these fiestas and festivals are vibrantly celebrated with dancing, music, food and fireworks. There are long street processions with elaborately decorated processions and parades as participants are donned in their traditional costumes.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Web Site and Get more information on location maisons de vacances espagnolesHere you can read my articles :-- http://www.articlesbase.com/destinations-articles/interesting-offerings-from-andalucia-6211278.html. Top 5 Best Golf Courses in Spain

Valderrama Golf Club: it is in Costa del Sol and happens to be the biggest in the southern region in Spain. It is only a few hours’ drive from Malaga and Cadiz and it is therefore one of the most popular golfing centers in the region. The most amazing feature of the golf club is that it is situated in an area whose climate is ideal for all year golfing. This means that you can enjoy a golfing holiday here at any given time of the year. The course is of champion’s quality but it also perfectly accommodates handicapped players.La Reserva Club de Golf: also located in Costa de la Luz, this club has 18 hole course. It is the wonderful creation of Cabell Robinson and covers a huge portion or land. This golf club makes it to the list of Spain’s most prestigious courses and you will therefore find golfers in huge numbers here throughout the year.La Manga Golf Club: it is in Costa Calida Murcia and is a world popular leisure and gold resort. It has a prestige award to it making it recognized across the world and it is therefore one of the best places you can choose to enjoy your golfing holiday. It is only a few minutes from the San Javier airport with the location making it even more popular with the visitors coming into the country for the golfing holidays.La Cala Golf Resort: this golf resort is located in Malaga. It happens to be the largest golf resort in Spain and this means that golf lovers flock here throughout the year to enjoy what it has to offer to them. The course layout is interesting and quite professional and it occupies a vast area in the coast. It stands between the Mediterranean and the Mijas Natural Park thus has lots of other interesting things that the visitors can enjoy during their holidays here.Marbella Golf Country Club: it is in Marbella Costa del Sol and a wonderful place for a deserved golfing holiday. It is said to be Europe’s most challenging and best golf course and was designed by famed Robert Trent Jones Senior. This course is actually the biggest of Costa del Sol’s remaining green areas and the courses are quite beautiful and enormous. It is definitely one of the best spots for a golfing holiday in Spain.If you are looking for a luxurious villa for holidays Visit Here and Get more information on location maisons costa bravaHere you can read my articles :-- http://www.fusicles.co.uk/Articles/tabid/189/articleType/ArticleView/articleId/146550/Costa-Brava-the-Romantic-Coastline-of-Spain.aspx. Touristic Spain

Spain has lots of interesting things to offer to all visitors coming here. It is actually one of the most popular holiday destinations in the world and tourists come into the country from all over the world to enjoy the natural beauty and all the treasures that it has. All kinds of the holidays can be enjoyed from Spain including green, beach and spa holidays. There are actually people who come here for golf holidays since it has some of the best golf areas and courses.

Among the attractions that you cannot miss out on include the islands and the splendid beaches. They are in plenty and they have lots of interesting and fun activities to offer. The reason as to why people find the country ideal for holidays especially on the islands is because some of them have very friendly and pleasant climate throughout the year thus making them ideal at any given time of the year for that deserved holidays.

You will have the choice of Balearic Islands and the Canary islands which are both groups of islands. The most outstanding thing about the islands is that even though they could be close to one another, the climate and the features can be very different thus meaning that you will get to enjoy a different kind of atmosphere from one island to another. They are some of the major highlights of the holidays in Spain. It however also has breathtaking mountain, hills, lagoons and breathtaking landscapes that will take your breath away.

The monuments are major attractions of the country. They are well represented by the various buildings with amazing architectural and historical value to the country and you will enjoy sightseeing. Spain is amazing since you will find the monuments well scattered in its region thus meaning that regardless of the section you choose to spend your holiday, you will have plenty of features to see and even learn a few things about.

The cathedrals and churches as well as museums are some of the monumental features you cannot miss out on while in Spain. It is also home to some of the best holiday resorts and hotels and you can therefore be assured that your accommodation and dining will be well taken care of throughout your stay. Water sports and land sports are numerous and depending on the spot you have chosen for the holiday, you will have some fun throughout the tour period.

Exciting Spanish Cities and Towns for a Holiday

There are many exciting cities in Spain that are worthy of more than a visit. These are famous European cities which offer some delightful holidays with their rich historical culture and traditions as well as natural landscapes such as mountains, beaches and islands.

Barcelona

This is one of Spain’s most exciting cities with more than enough to do, see, feel and taste. It is impossible to get bored in Barcelona as the city is ever lively with plenty of exciting historical spots and activities.

Barcelona becomes alive particularly in the summer with hundreds of thousands of tourists flocking in from every part of the world. Modernism and tradition combine comfortably with ancient monuments standing unabashedly with creative architectural structures by the renowned architect, Antoni Gaudi.

There are plenty of ancient castles in Barcelona that would occupy one’s time. These ancient castles offer some unique experiences with their exquisite architectural designs and numerous rooms that are intrinsically decorated. Barcelona’s ancient quarters have Gothic architecture including the magnificent Cathedral.

Figueres

Another exciting place of visit in Spain is Figueres which has a most intriguing museum called the Dali museum. This Northern Spanish museum sports an amazing architecture which was designed by Dali with art masterpieces on display.

Another popular attraction would be the soft sandy beaches around the city with lots of sea activities such as surfing, sailing, para-gliding, scuba diving and snorkeling.

San Sebastian

San Sebastian is another unique Spanish city that is cosmopolitan in nature with an air of sophistication as a resort destination. The tourist would enjoy the full range of luxuries in their preferred accommodation with the beautiful and scenic Atlantic coastline close by.

This is a popular spot for some summer fun in the sun. There is no lack of quality bars, pubs and restaurants to savor the tasty local tapas and other delightful cuisine serve in this region. San Sebastian is a popular Spanish holiday destination for its strategic location to France where the French frequents this quaint town.

It is not surprising that there is a unique mixture of French and Spanish culture and cuisine at San Sebastian. One can enjoy some spectacular architectural structures in and around San Sebastian such as the Guggenheim Museum.

Pamplona

This Spanish town is rich with history as well as tradition. The infamous Spanish Bull Run is an annual activity at Pamplona with thousands coming in to enjoy the Bull Run fiesta or the San Fermin fiesta.

More Than Meets the Eye at Andorra la Vella

One of the lesser known towns of Spain is Andorra la Vella. This town is located at the eastern side of the majestic Pyrenees Mountains. From one angle, this mountain range looms majestically above Andorra la Vella to give it a most picturesque view.

Andorra is an ideal holiday destination for those who desire a diverse yet Spanish culture. With its strategic location near to France, it is not surprising to have many French visitors throughout the year.

Background

Andorra is the capital in Andorra Principality with 45% Spaniards, 33% Andorreans, 11% Portuguese and 7% French. This cosmopolitan community offers a diverse culture that is so rich and attractive.

Catalan is the main communication language spoken at Andorra with Castilian, French and Portuguese frequently heard. Andorra la Vella means Old Andorra which refers to its ancient origins.

The town was one of the region’s early settlements with numerous stoned streets and homes; it was called Barri Antic due to the simple homes of its early settlers. Andorra flourished easily and quickly over time to be the cosmopolitan darling of Spain with quite a bit of modernism although its ancient quarter is retained to add on to the charm of the town. This section allows visitors to get a feel of the medieval times of Andorra with all its mysticism and beauty.

Architectural Delights

There are plenty of great architectural delights in Andorra la Vella. Near the ancient quarter lies the Sant Esteve church with antique structures that are incomparable in Andorra or its surrounding region. This 11th century church was built by the Romans; hence, the Romanesque architecture is very obvious. Several intriguing paintings hang inside this ancient church which sports fascinating designs on its interior. Both the interior designs and the paintings prove to be more than a casual visit or stopover at this church.

These are ancient art pieces that are unique and well painted which would amaze many tourists today.

Another impressive architecture at Andorra is Casa de la Vall. This ancient castle is majestic in its architectural structure which served as Andorra’s parliament house in the 16th century. It is called the House of Valley which was built in the 1580s as a prominent family’s residence. The Andorran government soon converted it as a parliament house.

The architectural design of this castle is very unique for its exterior as well as interior. The building is also very rich in history which all visitors should enjoy.

The Amazing Alhambra at Grenada

One of the greatest treasures in Grenada is the ancient but magnificent Alhambra. It is one of the most exquisite Moorish architecture that can be seen today. Its lofty hill position makes it stand out all thea more as one of the intriguing sights in Grenada. It would take tourists several hours to explore the Alhambra where the intrinsic designs and textures can be feasted.

Historical value

Grenada’s Alhambra is renowned as the best ancient Moorish architecture in Europe that has been well preserved for today’s viewing. This ancient fortress is magnificent in its structure that is second to none in the region. The Arabic term Alhambra means ‘the Red Castle’. Moorish poets have likened the Alhambra to a pearl among emeralds.

The strategic location of Alhambra enforces its value as a strong fortress of defense. The river flows at the north with the majestic and invincible Sierra Nevada. This fort was built by Sawar ben Hamdun in the 9th century who converted the smaller Alcazaba fort into the formidable Alhambra fortress.

The Alhambra was a very revered fortress serving as a royal residence with exquisite Arabesque furnishings and architecture.

However, the Christians Re-conquest took over the city in 1492 with Renaissance style changes on the architecture of the Alhambra. It soon became the winter palace of King Charles V with little Moorish architecture left in place.

In 1812, the French destroyed two of Alhambra’s towers; Napoleon nearly demolished the Alhambra but his plan was thwarted by a discontented soldier. However, a natural calamity did extensive damage on the Alhambra in 1821. Jose Contreras led a team to repair and restore the grandeur of the Alhambra in 1828.

Structural beauty

There are many beautifully designed sections in the Alhambra. One of them is the Lions Patio. It is a courtyard in a rectangular shape with 124 marble columns. Every arch of the gallery showcases exquisite Arabesques artwork. Twelve white marble lion statues stand majestically around a fountain at the center of the courtyard which is known as the Fountain of the Lions.

The biggest room inside the Alhambra is the Ambassadors Hall which is a reception area. In the past, it was used to welcome visitors during the Moorish kings’ rule. There are intricate designs on the walls and ceilings in the Alhambra depicting the heavens in gold, blue and white designs.

The two Sisters Hall contains 2 large slabs of smooth marbles with a fountain inside and a honeycombed dome ceiling that bespoke beautiful Moorish architecture.

An Idyllic Costa del Sol Holiday

Almost all Europeans love a sunny holiday especially when it is at the beach. The cool sea breeze and warm waters are quite enough to attract them for a weekend holiday; the inclusion of soft sandy beaches would be an additional benefit. Hence, Costa del Sol remains a strong favorite as a popular European holiday destination.

Offerings

Costa del Sol is famous for its constant supply of sunshine, soft sands and sea. These are the main attractions to its shores which stretch for miles. The amazing weather conditions bring on flocks of tourists especially during the summer in the months of June through September. Tourists come in droves to enjoy the white sandy beaches and the crystal clear waters of the Mediterranean.

Costa del Sol is deemed a tourist’s haven to bask in the sun and enjoy the plethora of water activities available.

The night is full of life at Costa del Sol. There is always something happening at the beachfront with rows of lively pubs, bars and clubs which open until the early morning hours. There are also plenty of delightful restaurants which serve delectable local cuisine that satisfies the appetite all day long.

The locals offer a special hospitality that is renowned with low crime rate that beckons more tourists to the shores of Costa del Sol.

Accessibility

Costa del Sol is easily accessible via the growing modernization works that are constantly happening in the region. Roads leading to Costa del Sol are constantly improved which encourage more tourists every year.

With the enhanced airport facilities at Malaga airport, international flights are catered to reach Costa del Sol easily via major nearby towns and cities such as Granada, Jerez and Gibraltar. The local transportation that is constantly improving also beckons more to Costa del Sol’s shores. One can also opt for a rental car or caravan to enjoy the best of Costa del Sol and other interesting Spanish towns and cities on their own itinerary.

Choices

More and more tourists are opting for free-and-easy holidays exploring the place at their leisure to get the best of the holiday in Spain. Costa del Sol is one of the preferred choices of holiday in Spain with the lovely beaches and natural landscapes around. There are wild life parks, marinas, coves and bays which can be explored by those who are more adventurous.

There are plenty of walking trails at reserved forests while avid hikers can be challenged on various mountain trails around the region.

Religious Significance at Santiago de Compostela

There are many towns and cities in Spain which are considered as ‘religious’ areas. These Spanish towns and cities such as Santiago de Compostela are just like Rome and Jerusalem. Santiago de Copostela or Santiago is considered as one of Spain’s most holy cities where hundreds of thousands of Catholic pilgrims come by for their annual absolution pilgrimage.

Historical significance

Santiago is the city where the famous Saint James apostle was renowned for his missionary work after Jesus was crucified. Santiago means James in Spanish; he was one of the apostles of Jesus who was beheaded in Jerusalem; however, his remains were taken to be buried in Galicia by the other disciples.

In the year 813, Santiago’s bones were exhumed and authenticated by a Christian hermit before they were placed in the Cathedral that was built by King Alphonso II.

Pilgrimage route

There is more than one route to experience the pilgrimage of St. James. The famous Pilgrimage Way can be via the French route entering Spain through the majestic Pyrenees Mountains. Alternatively, there is the Northern route via Spain’s Basque country or the Silver route which is the southern route via Andalusia. There is also the Portuguese route via Oporto and Tui which is a Galician city. Finally, there is the English route or the Maritime route via A Coruna or Ferrol from the north of Europe.

Whichever pilgrimage route is taken, there would surely be a lot of walking. Pilgrims are expected to walk a good portion of the pilgrimage route as a show of sincerity in their faith. The Saint James pilgrimage route is an Appalachian Trail to display one’s absolution. A pilgrim is required to complete at least the final 100 km by foot; a bicycle or horse can be used to complete the final 200 km. A small boat can be used to complete 40 nautical miles before walking to the designated Pontecesures port.

The pilgrimage is complete at Santiago where a religious ritual is required before entering the cathedral.

Religious observations

Once the pilgrims enter the cathedral from their completed walk, pilgrims qualify to touch any marble pillar available or bump one’s head on any revered sculptured figures as an act of repentance and reverence.

The pilgrims are to face the image of St. James which is on the altar before embracing it from its back. Pilgrims then move on down to the apostle’s crypt to sight the silver box containing the apostle’s remains. With the completion of these routines, the pilgrims can collect the La Campostela Latin certificate from the Pilgrimage office.

The Popular Cities In Spain

Spain is one of the most beautiful countries in the world and it enjoys a lot of diversity. The location of the country is in Europe’s south west. The peninsula of Iberia is shared by Spain with other countries including Andorra, Gibraltar and Portugal. In the northeast is the country of France. The Balearic and Canary Islands are its territories in the Mediterranean Sea and Atlantic Ocean respectively. Tourism in the region is truly enriching as it opens up some overseas destinations.

The cultural and geographical diversity of Spain is very incredible. A lot of tourists get some pleasant surprises on arrival to the country. Most people visit Spain expecting to only enjoy some beach tourism only to realize later just how much more the country has to offer. There are desert regions, snowy mountains, hills, green valleys, lush meadows, among other landscapes. The beach areas which are the more popular regions are vast. There are the small creeks, white sand areas, as well as the black sands found on the beaches of the Canary Islands. The black sands are due to the volcanic activities. Beach areas are perfect for people who are in Spain to enjoy the sun.

In the last decade, Spain has been awarded more recognition as a tourist destination of choice as more tourists flock into the country every year. This is due to more and more people discovering many interesting things about Spain. It is actually ranked third in the whole of Europe.

The capital city Madrid is one of the most popular places in Spain, the location of the city makes it the perfect place for communication with all the other provinces. The Spanish government as well as the palace for royalty is located here. The streets are something to behold. There are also museums and monuments to look out for in Spain.

Barcelona is also an amazing city. It is a favourite among tourists and is popular throughout the world. The famous Gaudi who was an architect has most of his works in Barcelona. There are beaches and coastal regions where you can enjoy water sports.

Cordoba is yet another interesting city to visit. There are many monuments in the city. The most popular works are the synagogue, the fortress of Alcazar, and the Moorish Mezquita.

Torremolinos, Marbella, Fuengirola and Costa del Sol are also great places to tour. While in Costa Sol, trips to towns as well as morocco can be organized. Shopping tours are also possible and can be guided.

Nature Attractions of Valencia

Valencia is indeed a nature pack comprising of urban parks, sandy beaches, nature reserves and also wildlife parks. This combination of natural features opens a great world of exploration and enjoyment to all visitors and it is therefore one of the most popular holiday spots in Spain. Among the numerous natural spaces, there are those which are a must see and visit while in a Valencia holiday.

Nature reserve of La Albufera: the unique beauty of this nature reserve is the most outstanding. It has a huge lake Albufera for its surroundings and the birdlife is wonderful. You will find different bird species within the reserve. The nature reserve also has nature park Albufera within it. Other intresting features that you will enjoy when visiting the reserve include beaches, golfing greens and El Palmar that is a beautiful nice village.

Valencia Bioparc: it is a beautiful natural zoo that is definitely worth checking out while in Valencia. It is also an interesting recreational area and a zoological park of the new generation hence is one of the major nature attractions in Valencia. You will enjoy the African ride in the heart of Valencia as you enjoy free environment, gorillas, chimpanzees and lions. The Bioparc is one of the places you cannot afford to miss out on in Valencia.

Turia Gardens: this garden is well kept and truly a natural beauty. It is exquisite in every sense and it has been known as a green city for the longest time. It is definitely a beauty for all nature lovers and other areas surrounding it add to the spectacle that it is. They include mountain villages and mountains that are yet to be disturbed by human hand and touristic developments. The areas are some of the most natural areas that you can experience in Valencia.

Valencia Beaches: they are what most tourists look for when choosing an ideal holiday destination. Beachgoers will find the city a paradise with so many golden soft sandy beaches. You will enjoy the cool breeze of the Mediterranean in these beaches as you engage in numerous interesting water sports and beach games.

The Oceanografic: it is Europe’s biggest aquarium and a major attraction in Valencia. It has thousands of underwater species and also fauna. The most attractive are the dolphins and sharks that most people long to see in their lives. It is an aquarium occupying loads of square meters and volumes of water and is located at City of Arts and Sciences here in Valencia.

Museums As A Tourist Attraction To Spain

Spain is home to 1,400 plus museums. This owes o the fact that the country is a home to many heritage sites that are found in many places. The country is also rich in history and in the past it received a lot of visitors that left a lot of marks in Spain. It is also because of the many artists as well as architects who had their homes in the country. Some of the artists whose works are displayed in the various museums include Kandinsky, Van Gogh, Monet, Tintoretto, Ell Greco, Picasso, Miro, Goya as well as Velazquez.

The Prado museum is one of the most popular museums in Spain and a visitor in the country should not miss an opportunity to visit this amazing museum. It is the best place to sample some of the best masterpieces of the renowned artists that ever lived. Its art collections are said to be the most important pieces ever. There are not only paintings in the museums; there are other museums that handle different things. Some of the museums include maritime, archeological as well as science museums.

The architecture Museum is one of the places one should consider visiting. For those who love the great works of the architect Antoni Gaudi, you will get to appreciate the genius in 4D materials that are audiovisual. This embraces new technologies as well as enables you to understand the artist’s language. In the museums, there are interactive panels that help to explain the artist’s projects, decoration, architectural work as well as heir biography.

In Guell Park, there is the 300 m skyscraper that was designed by Gaudi. The audiovisual representations in the museums are able to give some modern interpretations about the inspirations of the artists as well as the role of the creations nature.

The centre that is able to clearly teach about the cultural as well as the scientific sides of all energy and how the society is affected is the national energy museum. Due to the museums recovery project on heritage, it was awarded the Nostra award. There are two platforms where visitors can learn a lot about energy in all aspects.

There is also the provincial museum of fine arts. It covers art history since the 12th century to date. The arrangement is as original as possible as frames are arranged in one single row. The museums found here include Museum of Modern Art as well as The Bilbao Museum of Fine arts. There are works exceeding 6000.

There are also private museums that are best for cultural activities.

Tourism Regions In Andalusia Spain

Spain is the third most visited country in the world. It receives millions of tourists each year. It has a lot of facilities to cater for the needs of the tourists that visit every year which include hotels, restaurant and entertainment facilities.

One of the most visited places in Spain is Andalusia. There are so many exciting places to visit while in the region and it is always a fascinating area to be. The capital of Andalusia is Seville which has some of the most interesting religious processions taking place every year at around Easter time. Seville ranks third in size compared to other cities in Spain. It has a unique ambiance and has many monuments. The highlights include Barrio Santa Cruz, Torre Del Oro, the cathedral, the landmark, and belltower Giralda.

Granada is yet another exciting place. It is a place often referred to as Moorish jewel. The location of Granada is at the very foot of Sierra Nevada. Sierra Nevada is a mountain range popular for skiing activities. Alhambra, which is an Arabian palace, is the most outstanding place in Granada.

Cordoba is a Moorish centre where the monuments which have outstanding and great importance are preserved. The highlight of Cordoba is Great Mosque of Cordoba. It is the best place to appreciate Moorish work.

The main attraction in the region of Malaga is Alcazaba which is Moorish. The Mediterranean coast is also quite a place to be and is also found in this region.

Malaga’s coast is a very significant place and has a lot of importance in the tourism sector. There are some of the most spectacular beaches in the region. The climate is smooth and there are some amazing installations. The most popular centers include Nerja, Torremolinos, Mijas, Benalmádena, Fuengirola, Marbella, Puerto Banas, and Estepeño.

Ronda is yet another place to be. The area is surrounded by a mountain range that is very impressive. Ronda is a very beautiful town.

The Bronze Age remains are found in a place called Antequera. There are mountain ranges in the area but the most outstanding highlights are the monuments which are indeed exceptional. The mountain range in this region is Torcal de Antequera.

The Almeria region is a great place where the Moorish heritage is preserved. The greatest attraction in the area is Costa de Almeria. Famous centers in the area are Vera, El Toyo, Aguadulce, Roquetas de Mar, Almerimar and Adra.

Other areas in Andalusia include Cadiz, Huelva, Donana national Park, Costa de la Luz, Jerez de la Frontera as well as Jaen. Al these paces are a wonder to behold.
